intro: Ceropegia malagasica, commonly known as the Madagascar ceropegia, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae and is characterized by its trailing stems and tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in sunny to partially shaded environments. Its flowers are often pale green or white, with a unique structure that attracts specific pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
